message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.HC

The paper proposes a novel method for phase recognition in laparoscopic videos using a convolutional neural network (CNN) and focuses on visual information. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new CNN architecture for multi-task recognition, which suggests that it could also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The use of laparoscopic videos and the focus on medical applications could also make it relevant to the multimedia (cs.MM) and information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories. Finally, the potential medical applications of the proposed method could also make it relevant to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category.
